thread.title: Texas-San Antonio manhandles UTEP in 25-6 win
thread.title_full: Texas-San Antonio manhandles UTEP in 25-6 win

author: The Associated Press
title: Texas-San Antonio manhandles UTEP in 25-6 win
text:
Texas-San Antonio manhandles UTEP in 25-6 win The Associated Press Order Reprint of this Story EL PASO, Texas 
Jarveon Williams had 28 carries for 133 yards and a touchdown as Texas-San Antonio beat Texas El Paso 25-6 in game delayed twice by lightning Saturday night. 
The Roadrunners (1-4, 1-0 Conference USA) avoided their first five-game losing streak in program history. Williams' 28 carries was a school record. 
UTSA's Daniel Portillo had the only points of the first half with a 30-yard field goal. The Roadrunners extended it to 5-0 after tackling Miners' running back Kavika Johnson in the end zone for a safety. 
Williams scored on a 25-yard run to make 12-0, then Michael Egwuagu had a pick-6 taking Ryan Metz's pass 40 yards making it 18-0. The point after failed. 
UTEP (2-3, 0-1) scored when Metz found Jaquan White from 25 yards to make it 18-6 as the two-point conversion failed. Nate Gaines capped the scoring intercepting Metz and returning it 11 yards. Metz threw for 198 yards and four interceptions. Related content
